targetExampleSentences: Era viejo, pero probablemente no tan viejo como aparentaba.
nativeExampleSentences: He was old, but probably not as old as he looked.

targetExampleSentences: ¿Debería quedarme con mi coche viejo o comprarme uno nuevo?
nativeExampleSentences: Should I keep my old car or buy a new one?

targetExampleSentences: Llevo una camisa muy vieja llena de agujeros.
nativeExampleSentences: I'm wearing a very old shirt full of holes.

targetExampleSentences: Es un viejo, pero también un pescador experimentado.
Hay una vieja en una mecedora.
nativeExampleSentences: He is an old man as well as an experienced fisherman.
There is an old woman in a rocking chair.
What are you doing around here, buddy?
Hello, mate! It's been a while!

targetExampleSentences: Mi viejo no me para de fastidiar.
Vivo con mi vieja y mi hermana en Inglaterra.
nativeExampleSentences: My dad won't stop nagging me.
I live with my mom and my sister in England.

targetExampleSentences: Mi viejo trabaja doce horas, así que no llega a casa hasta pasadas las siete.
Mi vieja y yo estamos buscando un sitio mejor para vivir.
nativeExampleSentences: My old man works twelve-hour day shifts so he doesn't get home until after seven.
My old lady and I are trying to find a better place to live.
